title: Teacher Capacity-Building Program for Design-Based Science Inquiry Classes

context.prior_knowledge: Core scientific knowledge (physics, chemistry, biology, earth science), comprehension of experimental design and variable control, and at least three years of teaching experience
context.additional_context: Content optimized for smartphone-based learning activities (emphasizing observation, measurement, data visualization). Promotes scientific discussion using real-time collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Jamboard).

learning_goals: Cultivate instructional design capabilities that strengthen experimental design and variable control skills by applying the design thinking process in science classes.

Within one week, learners design one 3–5-minute microlearning science module executable on mobile devices (smartphones/tablets), submit a prototype reflecting the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis → experiment → analysis → conclusion), and meet 4+ of 5 evaluation checklist criteria.
Enhance the ability to provide effective instructional design feedback and converge on scientifically evidence-based designs through collaboration with peer teachers.

resources: AR Content Samples for Science Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
